We provide reliable and actionable information through rapid diagnostic tests, enhancing clinical and economic health outcomes globally. Headquartered in the US, we focus on rapid diagnostics for infectious disease, cardiometabolic disease and toxicology. Please visit www.alere.com
 
Alere eScreen is now Abbott, located in Kansas City, MO was designed to be the ultimate management solution for nationwide employee screening programs. We provide automated hiring program solutions for some of the nation’s largest employment programs. Today with more than 4,000 occupational health providers and as the only truly integrated, electronic drug testing solution in the industry, the capabilities are virtually limitless in our ability to simplify local and nationwide testing.At Alere eScreen we are driven by the vision, passion and dedication of our employees. We are committed to developing and delivering innovative products and services which automate and streamline the employee screening process by combining cutting-edge technology with superior customer service. We are looking for qualified professionals who are interested in joining an innovative team. We look for individuals with the expertise, passion, and drive to contribute to a team that is committed to providing superior customer service. Alere eScreen offers a wide range of employment opportunities. We offer great benefits and a variety of employee programs. We promote a fun, open and engaging work environment and we encourage our employees to grow and develop for future internal opportunities. If you are seeking a fun and innovative place to work, we invite you to apply at Abbott!
 
POSITION SUMMARY 
To complete all required functions in the Clinic.  To complete all required reports and call backs in relation to all the Clinic and administrative requirements.  Responsible for ensuring the medical services are completed to the OH&S standards and policies of eScreen Canada ULC.
 
 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES - (KEY ACTIVITIES)

Technician in the Richmond SAMHSA-certified laboratory of Alere.  The individual filling this position will be
responsible for preparation, extraction, and sample vial preparation of samples
for GC/MS confirmation in accordance with the SAMHSA mandatory guidelines and
those of other regulatory organizations.

necessary to perform extractions – 10% of time spent on this taskDesired

equipment successfully and perform routine maintenance Essential

controls, calibrators, and reagents.

Result: Must comply with current SOP’s
and regulatory guidelines Essential
Function: Adherence to all established
guidelines outlined in Alere’s Employee HandbookDesired
Result: Must comply with company policies Required

when subpoenaed to testify in legal proceedings.  Travel o other domestic alere offices may
also be required Additional

Job Description - Agency Planner Intern (0089493)Job Description Agency Planner Intern - (0089493) Epsilon is an all-encompassing global marketing company, a leader in creating connections between people and brands. We find, acquire and retain customers for brands around the world. We are the first of a new breed, harnessing rich data, groundbreaking technologies, engaging creative and transformative ideas to get the results our clients require. Epsilon’s Agency Practice is seeking an Agency Planner Intern who will be responsible for synthesizing qualitative & quantitative data, supporting creative teams, and constantly exploring innovative ways for our clients to reach customers. A strong candidate for the Agency Planner internship position would be: Innately curious about people. You love people watching and wondering what on earth is going on inside their head. You can’t help but wonder where they’ve been in the past and what their future might hold. You complete their entire life story in five short minutes…all in your mind, of course. A good storyteller. You could take that life story and bring it to life with passion, creativity and confidence, keeping listeners engaged and interested. An insight hunter. Information is limitless. Knowledge is not. At every phase of work, you have an ability to find key insights & work with the team to piece them together into a persuasive argument. Bold. You aren’t scared of uncharted territories for learning & thinking. Actually, you welcome the unknown. Responsibilities in the Role Synthesize quantitative + qualitative data 


Extract data-based consumer insights that will help drive marketing strategy 

Has a knack for bringing data to life through creative storytelling 

Conduct qualitative research using a variety of market research tactics in order to monitor cultural and social trends and how they impact consumers’ attitudes and behaviors 
Support creative development 


Have an ability to make complex subjects understandable 

Provide research to help support a clearly defined brief 

Possesses an understanding of multi-channel, CRM marketing 
Bring more to the table


Constantly exploring innovative ways to reach consumers 

Sees him/herself as being on the forefront of anything cutting edge and shares ideas with the team 

More social/digital savvy than the average Millennial & able to prove it. 
Qualifications 


Proficient in MS Office 

Typically a major in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, Psychology, but if you really want it, just prove it to us 

Understands qualitative research 

Familiarity with third party research tools (Simmons, ComScore, MRI, etc.)

Leadership experience 

Works well in a collaborative environment 

Strong communication skills   Conditions of Employment

Alliance Data
 
Account Protection Representative – Call Center Agent (Finance)
 
About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data!  As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are. 
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 

Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs
401(k) with company match
Employee stock purchase plan
Paid time off
Back-up child care
Tuition reimbursement
A dynamic and innovative work environment
Countless career and development opportunities
And so much more!
 
 

Account Protection / Triage – Call Center Agent 
 
 Job Requirements
 
 
As an Account Protection Representative, you will be responsible for reducing fraud loss by utilizing various fraud detection tools, to review and verify customer behavioral activity, thereby minimizing fraud losses and reducing risk. Additionally, you will be accountable for working new credit applications and fraud mail inquiries.
 
Opportunities are achieved through reviewing and verifying information on existing accounts, through inbound calls. Position requires proactive decision making skills and excellent problem solving. You play a key role in contributing to our profitability and retaining customer loyalty while minimizing credit loss resulting from Fraud.
 
 
 

Reviewing and verifying customer behavioral activity and identifying potential fraudulent activities.
Receive incoming and make outgoing investigative and verification phone calls to customers to minimize fraud losses and risk exposure.
Provide courteous and professional service to customer, even in potentially escalating situations, Commenity/Commenity Capital in the most positive manner always.
Escalate any fraud issues to the appropriate department manager or investigative unit for proper resolution.
Process new credit applications.
Maintain up to date knowledge of current fraud trends.
Demonstrates excellent oral and written communication skills; possesses strong analytical skills; proven eye for detail; shows effective time management skills; working knowledge of MS Word and Excel.
 
 
  Minimum Qualifications: 
 

High school diploma or GED
Stable employment record
Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times
Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner
Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background and credit check
Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
Schedule flexibility to work 40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends
 
Preferred Skills:

Strong research and analytical skills
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills
Organizational, detail and multi-tasking skills.
 
Preferred Qualifications:

Account Control experience 
Working knowledge of MS Excel, VCARS, COLTPX, NAGUI and Web Collections
Spanish Bilingual

The company utilizes database technologies and analytics to maximize the value, growth and loyalty of its clients' customers and assists clients in acquiring new customer relationships.Responsibilities:The Director, Incentive Compensation Design is a critical role in our sales compensation process and will report to the Sr. Director, Incentive Compensation. This position will be responsible for managing the plan design, policies, documentation, and distribution of incentive plans for all variable incentive plan participants across Epsilon. This position will ensure consistency on processes, policies, and legal compliance.• Review all incentive compensation plans being issued for reasonableness of target incentives and commission rates for as well as compliance with our policies.• Ensure Xactly incentive and commissions calculations comply with the plans.• Manage and provide input to the Sr. Director of Incentive Compensation and key team leaders in design of compensation plans, including Xactly and SFDC (salesforce.com) systems functionality, implementation process, and overall implementation timeline.• Drive issue resolution process for responding to escalated issues and questions concerning incentive plan design/metric and policies.• Responsible for ensuring SOX processes and audits are complete and reviewed.• Develop and implement Compensation Policies working with Legal, HR, Sales Operations and Sales and Client Services Management.• Collaborate extensively with Finance, Sales Operations, Human Resources, Sales, and Client Services.• Support integration of incentive compensation programs following M & A activities.• Manage development and distribution of training, presentation, and other materials for compensation program roll-outs.Qualifications:• 7-10 years of equivalent experience, sales compensation familiarity preferred• Experience in Compensation design, development, and administration• Professional with strong organizational, communication, and technical skills• Ability to communicate effectively with internal and external customers of all levels• Ability to manage programs and processes globally• Experience identifying areas for process improvement and driving solutions• Advanced analytical and problem solving skills• Management experience required• Advanced time management skills including ability to handle multiple projects with aggressive deadlines• Advanced Microsoft Excel skills including use of VBA, Vlookup, advanced formulas and scenario and statistical analysis• Experience with incentive compensation automation tools, Xactly knowledge a big plus• Bachelor’s degree required, Master’s preferred

Job Description - Information Security, Engineering & Operations Manager (0089404)Job Description Information Security, Engineering & Operations Manager - (0089404)  
The Information Security, Engineering & Operations Manager is responsible for managing a team of Card Services’ Security Engineering and the Security Operations Center (SOC). The position reports to the Director of Information Security and works closely with teams in other information security disciplines, IT infrastructure, and operations areas to help provide superior protection to Retail Services’ information assets. The Card Services Information Security Department provides security services in support of our two banks (Comenity Bank & Comenity Capital). 
 
Primary Duties: 

Manage a team of information security engineers responsible for configuring, deploying, and managing enterprise security tools including: SIEM, A/V, DLP, vulnerability scanning, privileged access management, file integrity monitoring, firewalls, advanced malware detection, etc. 
Manage a team of SOC Analysts who review, assess, and triage security events and guide the management events escalating into incidents.  
Manage the evolution of the SOC and Threat Intelligence programs that include, but are not limited to, supporting process, procedure, documentation, and technology.   
Participate in the security incident response process and triage incidents for escalation to appropriate stakeholders. As necessary, provide Tier 2/3 response support in investigating suspected incidents. Work with Information Technology to handoff/relay/escalate information security issues.
Partner with Information Security Risk Management to ensure compliance with policies and that risk is managed to accepted tolerances.
Work with the Change Advisory Board (CAB) to identify changes that will impact information security controls.
Maintain appropriate internal procedures to ensure senior management is aware of levels of control to comply with Payment Card Industry (PCI).
Hires and trains new staff. Conducts performance reviews and provides leadership and coaching.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.
Qualifications/Experience: 
 

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in relevant work experience. 
Six to 8 years experience in security administration, IT audit, and/or Information Technology field, with previous supervisory/management experience. 
Technical knowledge should include Network Security, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, Network access control, Security Incident & Event Management, system/application logging, and vulnerability scanning. 
Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) is required.

Job Description - Collections Account Representative – Call Center Agent (Finance) (0089596)Job Description Collections Account Representative – Call Center Agent (Finance) - (0089596) About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are. 
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Collections Account Representatives to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role receiving or making outbound calls to negotiate settlements or secure payment arrangements with customers who are between 1 – 6 months past due on their credit card accounts, with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. From manually dialing and skip tracing, to working with an automated dialer, your main focus will be to meet or exceed established goals to include balances saved, pay-by-phones collected and call quality.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 
·         Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!
·         Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
·         Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs
·         401(k) with company match
·         Employee stock purchase plan
·         Paid time off
·         Back-up child care
·         Tuition reimbursement
·         A dynamic and innovative work environment
·         Countless career and development opportunities
·         And so much more!
 
 

Collections Account Representative – Call Center Agent 
(Full Time / Accounts Receivable Support / Customer Service / Accounting / Finance)
 
Job Requirements
 
We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Agent who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with a background in banking or collections support to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
Minimum Qualifications: 
 
·         High school diploma or GED
·         Stable employment record
·         Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times
·         Schedule flexibility to work 40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends
·         Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner
·         Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check
·         Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
 
Preferred Skills:
·         Excellent computer abilities to navigate our care systems, as well as the Windows environment 
·         Ability to negotiation payment 
·         Strong problem solving skills
·         Basic data-entry and typing skills
·         Basic mathematical abilities
 
Preferred Qualifications:
·         Previous collections, call center or sales experience
 
 

Collections Account Representative – Call Center Agent 
(Full Time / Accounts Receivable Support / Customer Service / Accounting / Finance)
 
Build trust. Work Together. Communicate Openly. Innovate and Create. Teach and Learn. Give Back. Have fun and grow with us!  
Apply now!

Job Description - Senior BI Developer (0089372)Job Description Senior BI Developer - (0089372) Job Description for Senior BI Developer - SAP Business Objects BI concentration
 
Candidate will be a member of a team responsible for developing, managing and implementing state-of-the-art business intelligence solutions for the product engineering group predominantly with SAP Business Objects Web Intelligence and/or similar reporting frameworks.
 
Senior BI Developer - SAP Business Objects
Job responsibilities:


Development and support of business intelligence solutions in SAP Business Objects BI platform.

Work with SAP BO Web Intelligence Launchpad to design BI reports and with SAP BO Universe semantic layer to update and maintain reporting model on transactional databases and data warehouses.

Perform administrator tasks such as installations/upgrades, migration, maintenance, user access, security models and troubleshooting of Business Objects implementation in a multi-tenant SAP BO environment.

Provide estimates for BI solutions to be developed and deployed.

Document solutions and support handover to Level 1 and 2 support teams.

Follow Data Management processes and procedures and provide input to the creation of data definitions, business rules and data access methods

Collaborate with database administrators and data warehouse architects on database design and the technical architecture of the data delivery environment

Perform BI application maintenance and production support

Work in an agile environment and align with agile / scrum methodology for development work.
Technical Attributes:


3 - 5 years of development experience developing and administering BI solutions in SAP Business Objects BI platform (4.x preferred)

Experience in developing rich business intelligence reports on SAP BO Web Intelligence Launchpad.

Experience in working with SAP BO Universe semantic layer to develop reporting model on an OLTP or OLAP environment.

Experience in SAP BO administrator tasks such as installs/upgrades, user access, managing security models, environment maintenance and troubleshooting in a multi-tenant environment.

Fluent working with SAP BI Launchpad, Information Design Tool and Central Management Console for designing, developing and administering on the BI platform.

Strong knowledge of OLTP and relational database concepts and data warehouse concepts/best practices and data modeling

Ability to mentor, document solutions and provide technical guidance as needed.

Ability to write efficient SQL queries and tune/evaluate their performance.

Working knowledge of data design/data modeling

Experience with Tableau or other similar visualization software is a plus

Additional background / interest in other BI solutions or reporting tools is a plus.

Good verbal and written communication skills.

Job Description - Director, Marketing Operations (0089466)Job Description Director, Marketing Operations - (0089466) Operations Director, Marketing Technology
The Director Marketing Operations will lead the charge in designing and implementing business processes to support Epsilon’s marketing generation goals that drive profitable business growth. 
Responsible for developing and implementing operational processes and tools to better report on actionable insights regarding marketing programs to measure effectiveness, performance, and ROI of marketing spend.
 
Responsibilities:


Manage a team of support analysts and production monitoring engineers

Ensure that the application / database production environments and related processes are monitored promptly by the production monitoring team and any outages, breakdowns are identified, reported and resolved in a timely manner in coordination with internal support groups and product vendors

Ensure that the incoming client support tickets are analyzed, triaged and assigned to the appropriate team member and track them to closure

Engage with client personnel to understand incident behaviors, new enhancement requirements and also explain the status of resolutions provided for reported issues

Effectively manage the knowledge transition from development teams to the support teams through systematic KT plan, tracking, and KT effectiveness measurements

Track and measure SLA compliance levels for platform availability, performance and incident resolutions with the help of necessary tracking tools and systems

Capture SLA details and support related metrics / KPI information and report them to the leadership and client executive teams in a periodic manner

Ensure that the support services are delivered in accordance with the contractual terms and conditions and facilitate the creation and submission of incremental contracts (CR) for any additional services rendered

Ensure that the team members are adequately trained on technology and system functionality through systematic training plans on a regular basis

Look for opportunities to improve the overall platform operations through continuous process improvements, automation etc.

Take part in the strategic thinking activities together with the leadership and client business teams to take the best advantages of the products and services delivered and present ideas proactively for the improvement of overall platform ROI
Qualifications:


At least 12+ years of overall IT industry experience preferably in the database / backend / ERP / CRM systems

Good understanding of Digital / Multichannel marketing processes in retail / consumer goods industry including segmentation, targeting, campaign management, e-mail marketing, reward processing etc.

Good understanding of database systems and API based data integration processes

Knowledge about ITIL based support services delivery

Prior experience of working in large managed services / support engagements involving a minimum of 10 support engineers

Prior experience of working with global delivery teams, client teams and offshore delivery centers spread out globally
Knowledge of or experience with the following is preferred:


Relational Database Management Systems

Campaign Management tools

Business Intelligence tools

Data hygiene and Customer Data Integration

Web Technologies

Marketing concepts  Conditions of Employment

Job Description - .Net Technical Manager- Scrum Master- Product Development (0089521)Job Description .Net Technical Manager- Scrum Master- Product Development - (0089521) Summary
Development Manager is a hands-on position responsible for the design, development, testing, management and maintenance of software modules and people management within the Auto Delivery team.
 
Duties and responsibilities
 

Manage a team of Developers and provide technical direction and manage project timelines, cost and quality
Efficiently and effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical internal team members as well as third party client stakeholders.
As needed, gather requirements and analyze, understand and translate those requirements into technical specifications.
Participate in design reviews and provide input to design recommendations where necessary.
Participate in code reviews and acceptance process in order to improve methodology and delivery.
Perform and manage development in a high volume, multi-tiered, transactional environment.
 
Qualifications
 
Minimum qualifications


BE/B.Tech/MCA from an education institution of repute
Must have 10+ years of total IT experience out of which minimum 2 years of team leading and project mgmt. experience, of 5+ team members in last 2 engagements. Should have managed multiple projects simultaneously.
Must have worked with globally distributed teams.
Hands on experience of working with Data Integration/ETL tools like Informatica, ODI etc.
Should have a technical background in SQL Server or ORACLE database during the developer / Lead levels prior to taking up manager role.
Must be able to discuss technical aspects of architecture /design / code issues directly with technical teams.
Must be have experience in planning, analyzing requirements, designing solutions and developing code using .net technologies.
Experience with Agile development methodologies is required.
Must have experience with people management of 8+ developers. A strong desire to teach and mentor junior and mid-level developers and direct growth and goals of individual team members is essential.
Strong communication skills as well as a dedicated work ethic is a must.
The ability to display strong problem solving skills and perform under pressure is required.

Preferred qualifications
 

Prior experience with enterprise class application/web development as developer or manager strongly preferred.   Conditions of Employment

Job Description - Client Integration Engineer - French or German Speaker (0083842)Job Description Client Integration Engineer - French or German Speaker - (0083842) Conversant Media – 

Client Integration
Engineer – French or German Speaker

Thanks for your interest in Conversant!  Here’s the deal.  You’re not just applying to some basic
technology company.  Rather you’re
applying to a powerhouse that’s changing the face of an industry! 

We’re a new company with a 15-year heritage.  We’ve invested over $1 billion and united
five industry leaders: Commission Junction, Dotomi, Greystripe, Mediaplex and
ValueClick Media to launch and lead the Age of Personalization.  We’ve done what marketers have dreamed of for
years, introduced a single platform that offers all the data, technology,
insights and personalization it takes to make true 1:1 communication real. 

We couldn’t have done any of that without our team of
superstars and a culture that celebrates each one of them.  Individuals matter just as much within our
walls as they do in the 1:1 marketing programs we create for clients.   

Hello!

Conversant is committed to one simple but truly exciting
principle:  each person is different and
every person matters.  This mindset fuels
everything we do for our clients and for each other.  We do magic for our clients and we have fun
doing it.  If that sounds like your sort
of place, we’d love to hear more from you.”

What we believe:

Ownership - We’re
determined to make an impact preferably a big one every day. 

Integrity - We
treat our clients, customers and co-workers with genuine respect. 

Teamwork - We
believe everything worthwhile is achieved through collaboration.

Job Title: Client
Integration Engineer Description

The Client Integration Engineer is responsible for providing
technical solutions and strategies to achieve our client’s digital marketing
objectives, including integrating new clients onto the Conversant platform,
managing the technical relationship with existing clients; implementing new
platform capabilities, driving automation initiatives and providing technical
sales support.  

A Conversant Client Integration Engineer is a unique hybrid
role within our company that combines aspects of a web technologist, business
analyst, and solutions architect.  Our
Client Integration Engineers leverage their technical capabilities and
knowledge of the Conversant platform to design and deliver actionable
strategies and solutions.  

Work Environment 

• Highly motivated, collaborative, and results driven.

• Growing business within a dynamic and evolving industry. 

• Entrepreneurial approach to everything we do. 

• Continual focus on process improvement and automation. 

 

Essential Functions
and Responsibilities

Integrate some of the largest Internet companies into the
Conversant system: design, develop, implement and test technical solutions
based on client and business requirements 

• Be the technical subject matter expert and client liaison
while working with internal teams to drive the execution and delivery of key
client initiatives. Collaborate with Analytics, Account Management, Sales,
Media Managers, Studio, and Product Development. 

• Oversee client accounts, identify enhancement
opportunities and drive creative solutions that meet client marketing initiatives
and anticipate future needs.

• Thrive as an individual contributor and member of a very
dynamic, collaborative Client Integration Team.

Job Description - Collections Associate - Work at Home - (Finance) Kansas (0089616)Job Description Collections Associate - Work at Home - (Finance) Kansas - (0089616) Qualifications & Responsibilities
About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are. 
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Collections Account Representatives to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role receiving or making outbound calls to negotiate settlements or secure payment arrangements with customers who are between 4 – 6 months past due on their credit card accounts, with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. From manually dialing and skip tracing, to working with an automated dialer, your main focus will be to meet or exceed established goals to include balances saved, pay-by-phones collected and call quality.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 
Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!
·         Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
·         Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs
·         401(k) with company match
·         Employee stock purchase plan
·         Paid time off
·         Back-up child care
·         Tuition reimbursement
·         A dynamic and innovative work environment
·         Countless career and development opportunities
·         After initial onboarding and training, work from home
·         And so much more!
 
 
Job Requirements
 
We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Agent who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with a background in banking or collections support to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
This is considered a work from home position. You will begin working from home after you onboard and train on site at our Lenexa Care Center. To be successful in this role you will need the ability to work remotely from a local home office. 
 
Workspace Environment: A dedicated workspace that is able to simulate an office environment. The room should provide an area that separates you from others while working. 
 
Access to home/work space: You will provide Alliance Data or its representative access to your workspace to conduct an audit or your workspace for compliance to policies. A photograph of your workspace must be furnished prior to going home.
 
Equipment: Alliance Data will provide you with the equipment to work from home. This equipment is able to be used for work purposes only. 
 
Internet/Phone: The associate is required to pay for and provide internet and phone service. Internet service must be DSL or Cable (no wireless or satellite ISPs allowed), with at least 10 Mbps download and 2 Mbps upload speed required. An analog or digital phone service (No VOIP, no call waiting, no voicemail etc.) is required. High speed internet and phone lines will be dedicated lines that will be used exclusively for business use, and will be separate from any personal data or phone services.
 
Location: Although this position is considered work at home, the candidate must reside within 60 miles of the Lenexa Care Center.

 
 
Minimum Qualifications: 
 
·         High school diploma or GED
·         Stable employment record
·         Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times
·         Schedule flexibility to work 40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends
·         Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check
·         Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
 
 
Preferred Skills:
 
·         Excellent computer abilities to navigate our care systems, as well as the Windows environment 
·         Able to follow basic troubleshooting process if experiencing a technical issue
·         Ability to negotiation payment 
·         Strong problem solving skills
·         Basic data-entry and typing skills
·         Basic mathematical abilities
·         Previous experience telecommuting or working remotely, collections or sales experience

Job Description - Account Manager, Associate (0089476)Job Description Account Manager, Associate - (0089476) 
Do you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence.   We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!
.
 
Associate Account Managers play a key role in support of CJ's advertisers. They are responsible for maintaining all publisher relationships of behalf of the advertiser and are responsible for creating and executing recruitment and optimization campaigns. They contribute to the development of an affiliate marketing strategy for each advertiser, and are directly responsible for ensuring the successful execution of that strategy, including managing Account Representatives in their tactical execution.
 
Do these things interest you? You will:

Recruit, manage and develop publisher relationships on behalf of advertisers, communicating expectations, sharing best practices, disseminating offers and promotions, and providing account updates to an advertiser's largest/most important publishers.
Participate in building and presenting the advertiser strategy presentations and quarterly business reviews of results.
Identify new sources of revenue on behalf of advertisers by extending reach through new publisher relationships or optimizing affiliate marketing campaign strategies.
Lead recruitment and optimization components of weekly client calls, documenting and disseminating assigned tasks across client and CJ account teams, and ensuring successful execution of assigned tasks.
Train and develop Account Representatives, as well as leading their efforts to successfully execute tactical components of affiliate marketing campaigns.
Identify opportunities to better optimize campaign results by interpreting standard and custom reports
 
What we look for:

Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 2 years’ experience in the online marketing industry-ideally digital performance marketing.
Clear and effective communication and can convey complex results in a simple, clear manner, using solid business acumen, demonstrating a competent level command of digital marketing concepts.
Ability to influence/develop account strategies that leverage analysis and insights to contribute to meeting or exceeding advertiser objectives.
Ability to execute a variety of tasks within designated time frames, delivering exceptional quality results and are able to directly contribute to the formation of client campaigns and quarterly business results.
Results oriented problem solver
Proficient knowledge of the Microsoft suite of products including Windows, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

  


Why CJ Affiliate? 
CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.          
We offer comprehensive benefits including; competitive compensation, aggressive 401K match program, health and dental insurance, flexible time off, an Employee Stock purchase plan, fitness membership reimbursement, backup care program, flexible spending accounts, charitable donation matching and much, much more!  Our benefits are designed to care for you and your family – to keep you healthy - physically, emotionally, financially and socially.  
CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company also included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS. 
 
Conditions of Employment
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.

The Senior Statistician is responsible for applying and interpreting various statistical and data analysis techniques in support of a variety of analytic solutions. Responsibilities:• Provide quality, statistically valid analysis and related output • Employ and interpret appropriate data analysis techniques and statistical methodologies such as regression analysis (both linear and non-linear), cluster analysis, CHAID, factor analysis/principal component analysis, time series, survival models, experimental designs using SAS and other statistical software independently• Take a proactive role in analysis design and execution • Appropriately account for the timeliness and quality of all assignments• Collaborate with cross-functional internal resources• QA/QC data and analysis output to ensure accuracy• Manage multiple projects concurrently • Monitor project progress relative to timeline and scope• Present statistical results to both technical and non-technical audience in a clear mannerMinimum Qualifications:• Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g., statistics, economics, mathematics, marketing analytics) or significant relevant coursework• Minimum of 4 years of related experience• Proficiency with various statistical methodologies such as regression analysis (both linear and non-linear), cluster analysis, CHAID, factor analysis/principal component analysis, time series, survival models, experimental designs using SAS and other statistical software• Demonstrated proficiency in SAS/SQL programming• Proficiency in MS Office; including PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Outlook• Familiarity and basic knowledge of open source statistical programs like R, Python and KNime• Strong analytic thought process and ability to interpret findings• Ability to work on multiple assignments concurrently• Excellent verbal and written communication skills• Highly motivated and collaborative team player with strong interpersonal skills• Acute attention to detail (QA/QC)• Effective organization and time management skills• Professional judgmentDesirable Qualifications: • Advanced degree (Master’s/PhD) in Statistics, Economics or other quantitative discipline• Database marketing experience/knowledge• Working knowledge of Hadoop and other big data technologies

Job Description - Local Service Consultant (0089441)Job Description Local Service Consultant - (0089441) This is a work from home opportunity. You will require heavy travel to upwards of 75%. Job Overview: A Local Service Consultant is responsible for maintaining their territory which includes Dealer Performance Visits and Phone Calls within the Manufacturer required cycle. You will work to increase dealer participation with cadence programs while partnering with our Inside & Outside Sales Representatives increasing dealer satisfaction. This position is a consultative approach to servicing and requires exceptional customer service and dealer retention ability. Essential Duties & Responsibilities:• This is an account servicing position that is consultative in nature.• You are expected to consistently meet or exceed servicing plan goals by retaining Epsilon product portfolio to targeted clients; dealerships and dealer groups in assigned market area.• Conduct full needs assessment and recommend opportunities as appropriate while demonstrating extensive product knowledge.• Provide exceptional problem resolution by implementing solutions to dealerships’ needs.• This individual will actively participate in customer concern resolution and account cancellations along with performing other related corporate required duties.• Actively participate in customer concern resolution and cancellation turnaround attempts with maintaining consistent support and service to existing clients. Solve existing issues and determine solutions to prevent further concerns.• Assist with the rollout of new programs/products by reviewing all material for accuracy and providing feedback for improvement.• Improves product knowledge of new and existing products through self-study and usage of available resources.• Report daily on all activity with detailed, accurate entries in Salesforce.com of visits, issues, phone/email actions and any other pertinent client interactions.• The Position provides the availability of overnight travel to better facilitate efficient, effective management of the territory. Associates are expected to meet all position requirements regardless of whether overnight travel is utilized.• Establish and maintain professional relationships with local Manufacturer field representatives within the given territory.• Respond to management requests for information and follow up to support communication as required.• Represent Epsilon at appropriate trade shows, conventions and conferences in a professional manner which enhances and portrays in the best possible light in the marketplace.• This position is salary plus car allowance 
Qualifications/Desired Skillset:• Valid and unrestricted Driver’s License, required• Appropriate vehicle insurance, required• Clean driving record, required• Bachelor’s degree, preferred• Customer Service Experience, required• Automotive Experience, desired   Conditions of Employment

Job Description - Marketing Service Representative (0089517)Job Description Marketing Service Representative - (0089517) General Summary:
 
Represents Epsilon in assigned territory by providing excellent customer service by selling the Epsilon product line within existing customer base to ensure customer retention, customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Consistently meets or exceeds sales goals by selling Epsilon Products to Clients in assigned market area.  Provides proactive consultative services to assigned customer base to ensure loyalty and retention.  Review product results and recommend needed enhancements to maximize programs.  Identifies need for additional products and services and communicates as appropriate.   Recommends and develops direct mail promotions that address dealership concerns on a timely basis.  Manage territory activity to optimize support of assigned key customers.  Works with field team  in given territory to address dealership and company objectives with respect to sales goals and customer satisfaction.  Maintain and grows relationships with local OEM field representatives within the given territory.  Actively participates in customer concern resolution and cancellation turnaround attempts with consistent support and service to existing clients.  Solve existing issues and determine solutions to prevent further concerns.

Responds to regional and corporate requests for information and follow up to support communication.

Job Description - Director of Data Science (0089550)Job Description Director of Data Science - (0089550) Summary 

The Analytic Consulting Group
partners with internal and external clients and data providers, leveraging
predictive analytics and advanced statistical techniques to drive strategic
thought and effective decision making. The Data Science Director, plans,
manages and controls the activities of teams of statisticians that provide
advanced statistical solutions for our clients

 

This position requires an
individual with a combination of computational and analytical skills. The
candidate should have a solid foundation in computer science and
statistics/math with well-honed skills in the following areas:

Data Managementexperience with both structured and unstructured data, and
Hadoop or similar technologiesable to identify, join, explore and examine data from multiple
disparate sources and formatsability to reduce large quantities of unstructured or
formless data and get it into a form in which it can be analyzedability to deal with data imperfections such as missing
values, outliers, inconsistent formatting, etc.Statistics &
Modelingknowledge of statistical theories and techniques commonly
used in prediction and optimization modelsability and desire to go beneath the surface of a problem
and distill it into a clear set of hypotheses that can be testedDesign, plan, and manage projects from start to finish
& produce data-driven results with appropriate techniques to answer key
business questionsmastery of statistical programming languages such as R and
PythonMachine Learningexperience with machine learning algorithms, such as
k-nearest neighbors, random forests and ensemble methods and their
corresponding implementation packages in R or Pythonunderstand when it is appropriate to use different
techniquesexperience with distributed computing, such as Hadoop,
Spark or related technologiesSoftware Developmentthe ability to write code in programming languages such as
SAS, Java, R, and Pythoncapable of developing prototypes and fashion their own
tools to conduct analytic research

Qualifications

Advanced degree (Master’s/PhD) in Statistics, Computer
     Science or other quantitative disciplineMinimum of 8 years of related experienceMinimum 5 years proven managerial or supervisory
     experienceSolid planning, priority setting, and project
     management skills with experience managing multiple projects and resources
     concurrentlyExcellent verbal and written communications skills and
     good at developing relationships across diverse teams, including marketing
     and account teamsMastery of various statistical methodologies such as
     regression analysis (linear and non-linear), cluster analysis, CHAID, time
     series, survival modelsExperience with machine learningExperience with SQL, Scala, Python or JavaProficiency in at least one open source statistical
     program like R and KNimeWorking knowledge of Hadoop and other big data
     technologiesStrong understanding of Statistics and modeling
     techniquesStrong analytic thought process and ability to
     interpret findingsAbility to work on multiple assignments concurrently

 

In addition, the candidate should
have strong business acumen, and interpersonal and communication skills, yet
also be able to work independently. He/she should be able to communicate
findings and the way techniques work in a manner that all stakeholders, both
technical and non-technical, will understand.  Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.Great People, Deserve Great BenefitsWe know that we have some of the brightest and most talented associates in the world, and we believe in rewarding them accordingly.  If you work here, expect competitive pay, comprehensive health coverage, and endless opportunities to advance your career.  From tuition reimbursement to scholarship programs to employee stock purchase plans and 401(k)s, we offer associates a variety of benefits that work as hard for them as they work for us. About EpsilonEpsilon® is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator. Publisher Platform UI

 

Job Description

 

We may be the most important Internet company you’ve never
heard of. Join our team for your chance to work in the digital marketing space
and solve meaningful problems on a massive scale—and have fun doing it.

As a member of the Conversant Publisher Platform team you
will develop our new, cutting edge user interface tools.  You will work on our internal administration
exchange platform web tools in Java and Angular, as well as be a key player in
the development of our new client facing publisher portal.  Your work will be delivered to our large
publisher base servicing thousands of the web’s most premium brands and
destinations on all channels from desktop to mobile to TV.  You will understand, analyze and improve upon
our current technology infrastructure to help produce a best in class inventory
management platform for our exchange.

We are looking for the Software Engineer that is goal
oriented, adaptable, and always focused on asking the right questions – so we
can build the right answers.  You have
experience in UI full stack development, particularly with full stack UI web
development infrastructure.  You
understand all layers of the stack architecture and can work in each
accordingly.  You have hands-on
experience with a variety modern standard web based technologies and
programming languages and a strong understanding of software and system design
principles, patterns, performance tuning and maintenance concerns. You are also
very detail oriented and capable of handling many simultaneous tasks in
parallel.

 

Responsibilities


 Develop and program UI stacks
     and data pipelines (Java, Spring, Angular, REST)
 Work within software agile
     process

 Excellent UI programming, analytical
     and problem solving skills.
 Strong oral and written
     communication skills.
 UI technologies (Angular, MVC,
     REST, Spring, JavaScript, etc.)
 Software revision and control
     systems (e.g. GIT).
 Experience with bug tracking
     systems like JIRA.
 Must be able to read and
     understand software requirements and must be able to write software.
 BS degree in Computer Science
     or related field of study or 5+ years equivalent work experience
     specifications as required. 


 

Preferred Skills 

3+ years previous
experience with leading/managing software teams.

5+ years hands-on full
stack development experience.

Previous online
advertising and/or digital marketing experience.  Conditions of EmploymentAll job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.About ConversantConversant, Inc. is the leader in personalized digital marketing. Job Description - Workforce Analyst, Real Time (0089481)Job Description Workforce Analyst, Real Time - (0089481) 
Qualifications & Responsibilities
 
This position in the Alliance Data Command Center encompasses both the real-time workforce management and systems support roles that are required to deliver and execute daily strategies to guide our multi-site care center operation.
 
The position is responsible for the in depth analysis of daily volume and average handling time trends, the assessment of daily volume driving factors, same day interval level staff plans, and enterprise level performance communications.  
 
The position is empowered to influence the integrity of the command center support model by making operational change recommendations to leadership and leading the Command Center team through the execution of advanced real-time strategies.  The daily strategy changes greatly influence the ability to meet our contractual SLAs and enhance the overall customer experience.
 
This position requires a strong technical aptitude, to enable the individual to connect how our systems operate in order to troubleshoot, escalate, & mitigate impact during downtime related events.  
 

Analyzes workforce management data, including contact volume, average handling time, non-productive time and service performance results to lead & execute on real-time strategy decisions to meet our contractual service level agreements and operational expense goals. 
Monitors system performance, acts as first line of defense for major incidents that impact operations, appropriately escalates issues, manages outages & downtime scenarios, mitigates risk using DR strategies, communicates to operations leadership and IT, provides formal issue tracking, and influences overall business continuity. 
Evaluates and leads effectiveness of command center strategies and team’s real time response to managing planned and unplanned events, all in an effort to ensure effective utilization of call center phone support resources to achieve business objectives. Empowered to provide recommendations to Leadership to address obstacles that stand in the way of meeting objectives, which can include call center TSF, occupancy, shrinkage goals, and staffing expense concerns.
Leads testing, monitoring, & performance update communications to Leadership for new implementations,client driven programs, procedural changes, technology enhancements, etc.
Communicates global/enterprise level performance to executive leadership through advanced reports, analysis, and paging procedures. (Intraday/Daily/Monthly)
 
 
Qualifications: 
 

Previous insight into a multi-site and technically advanced call center
Excellent time management skills, ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish a solution and report facts
Strong business, operational, and procedural knowledge of a call center
Ability to lead team members, drive change, assume onsite leadership role when needed
Self-Motivated, ability to question current workflow processes and make recommendations to enhance process drive innovative changes.
Ability to support medium to complex projects
Solid project/change management skills
Proven leader amongst their peers
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to partner with technical teams to integrate support models and improve process
Highly collaborative individual with ability to influence others and build strong professional relationships.
 
Technical Skills

Strong analytical skills with the ability to evaluate, understand and report key metrics relevant to the call center
Ability to partner with reporting/technical teams to outline reporting requirements to develop new tools and capabilities
Aptitude for strategic planning and seeing the big picture
Strong knowledge of MS Office Suite, specifically MS Access and MS Excel, Power Point.
Ability to drive technical related projects to develop and enhance existing capabilities 
 
Desired

Knowledge of Workforce Management principle and disciplines
Knowledge of Incident Management, disaster recovery, business continuity practices
Knowledge of Call Center software including: IEX workforce management software, NICE Call recording and Avaya CMS.
Understanding of centralized virtual/VoIP telephony environments
Bachelor’s degree in a related area or relative experience
Understanding of mass alerting SMS/Text communication tools
Basic understanding of telecommunications as it relates to call flow configurations (ACD, IVR)
Understanding of LAN / WAN network configurations
Strong knowledge of Web based applications
Systems Performance Monitoring Tools
Citrix or VDI solutions
Forecasting and/or Statistics expertise
Advanced Excel user (pivot tables, V-Lookup)

Job Description - Outbound Collections Representative-Westerville (0089669)Job Description Outbound Collections Representative-Westerville - (0089669) 
About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are. 
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Collections Account Representatives to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role receiving or making outbound calls to negotiate settlements or secure payment arrangements with customers who are between 4 – 6 months past due on their credit card accounts, with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. From manually dialing and skip tracing, to working with an automated dialer, your main focus will be to meet or exceed established goals to include balances saved, pay-by-phones collected and call quality.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 


Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!

Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage

Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs

401(k) with company match

Employee stock purchase plan

Paid time off

Back-up child care

Tuition reimbursement

A dynamic and innovative work environment

Countless career and development opportunities

And so much more!
 
Job Requirements
 
We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Agent who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with a background in banking or collections support to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
Minimum Qualifications: 

High school diploma or GED

Stable employment record

Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times

Schedule flexibility to work 40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends

Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner

Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check

Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
 
Preferred Skills:


Excellent computer abilities to navigate our care systems, as well as the Windows environment 

Ability to negotiate payment 

Strong problem solving skills

Basic data-entry and typing skills

Basic mathematical abilities
 
Preferred Qualifications:


Previous collections, call center or sales experience  Alliance Data card services

Job Description - Security Officer - Rio (0089302)Job Description Security Officer - Rio - (0089302) Please note that for any candidate that receives an offer for this position will be required to pass a criminal background check as well as a Physical Ability Test (PAT). This PAT will consist of a 1.5 mile run on a treadmill in under 17 minutes and 145 pound drag 25 feet.
 







The hours for this position are Wed 5p-9p; Thurs-Sat 6p-6a.

The Security Officer greets every associate and visitor as they enter the Alliance Data facility, and controls all person’s access into the building.  This role requires someone who is customer centric who also possess a critical thinking skill set.  The Security Officer assists in crisis management when it comes to events such as weather related emergencies, associate medical emergencies, security related events, and other happenings as they arise.
 
Responsibilities:

Controls access into the building by verifying credentials and assigning visitor access as required.
Performs First Aid when needed.
Conducts safety checks of buildings and parking lots.
Writes incident and accident reports as required.
Assists with miscellaneous tasks as assigned. 
Minimum Qualifications:

Strong interpersonal and customer service skills. 
Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 
Ability to interact with individuals from all levels within the organization. 
Basic PC experience, including MS Office Suite.
Physical Requirements:

Must be able to respond on foot, quickly by running, to medical and security related incidents anywhere on the facility property.
Must be able to walk the interior and exterior of the facility several times throughout a shift in all weather conditions.
Must be able to lift and carry 50lbs. to pick-up and deliver packages, respond to medical incidents with a first aid bag (contains supplies, AED, Oxygen Unit), empty shred bins, and other instances as they arise.
Must be able to physically participate, train, and perform personnel protection and defense tactics. 
Must be able to pass a PAT (physical ability test).
Preferred Qualifications (not required):

1 year of law enforcement education, job experience, or military experience
CPR/First Aid training helpful

Job Description - Account Coordinator- Digital (0089639)Job Description Account Coordinator- Digital - (0089639) 
Position is based in Westborough, MA.Do you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence. We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!
Account Representatives play a key role in support of CJ's advertisers. As part of an account team, the Account Representative is responsible for providing tactical support in implementing digital marketing strategies and campaigns.
 
Do these things interest you? You will:

Help advertisers maximize the effectiveness and efficiency of their affiliate spend by building and interpreting reports that capture program performance
Build creative newsletters to inform publishers of updates, brand guidelines, performance objectives, etc.
Identify, recruit and review new publishers who can provide additional reach and revenue growth
Work with advertisers to troubleshoot complex data transfer issues, build new program terms, as well as ensure details are accurate and up-to-date
 
What we look for:

You have a Bachelor's Degree
You are passionate about providing excellent service to internal and external customers
You are driven to succeed
You are a clear and effective communicator
You are able to work independently and collaborate with your team to solve complex issues
You are proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel
You have strong analytical skills

  

Why CJ Affiliate? 
CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.   
         
We offer comprehensive benefits including; competitive compensation, aggressive 401K match program, health and dental insurance, flexible time off, an Employee Stock purchase plan, fitness membership reimbursement, backup care program, flexible spending accounts, charitable donation matching and much, much more!  Our benefits are designed to care for you and your family – to keep you healthy - physically, emotionally, financially and socially.  

CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company also included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS. 
 
Conditions of Employment
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.
 
For San Francisco Bay Area: Alliance Data will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. LI*DT

Job Description - Account Coordinator (0089501)Job Description Account Coordinator - (0089501) Qualifications & Responsibilities
 
The Account Coordinator (AC) is responsible for the effective workflow and communications for the assigned account. The AC works within the account team to execute activities for our clients. The AC responsibilities include:


 Creates presentations and presentation materials

Sets up onsite and offsite meetings

Prepare well-organized, clear and concise memos, conference reports and documentation

Communicate with clients and account team

Assist in gathering internal and external quotes

Assist in developing pricing and profit calculations and approvals

Assist in developing launch and production schedules

Assist in managing project workflow with production teams

Coordinate outside vendor production

Pursue and process approvals from account team, clients and production teams

Communicate project status and changes with account team, clients and production team

Assist in managing the workflow of projects from sales through production and close

Ensure client sign-off on all phases of production

Update client status reports

Assists in resolving problems with projects

Assist in cost tracking and ensure project is billed correctly

Process invoices and procure approvals on a timely basis

Process and distribute daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, or annual reports 

Coordinate postage funds, request postage invoices and complete postage reconciliations

Compose conference reports and distribute to all parties involved

Generates and distribute program reports

General office duties including reception, phone support and supplies

Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:


1 – 3 years of experience in related account support role

Excellent written & verbal communication skills

Able to work independently; self-starter, with strong initiative 

Highly organized and detail-oriented, while coordinating multiple projects simultaneously

A strong MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint expertise is a must

SalesForce.com application experience a plus

MS Visio and Basecamp experience a plus

Must be familiar with the use of presentations, meeting minutes, and status reports

In order to attend Onsite interview event, you must receive a formal
invitation via email. You will be asked to RSVP in order to confirm your
interview on October 18th. About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are. 
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Collections Account Representatives to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role receiving or making outbound calls to negotiate settlements or secure payment arrangements with customers who are between 4 – 6 months past due on their credit card accounts, with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. From manually dialing and skip tracing, to working with an automated dialer, your main focus will be to meet or exceed established goals to include balances saved, pay-by-phones collected and call quality.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 


Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!

Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage

Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs

401(k) with company match

Employee stock purchase plan

Paid time off

Back-up child care

Tuition reimbursement

A dynamic and innovative work environment

Countless career and development opportunities

And so much more!
 
Job Requirements
 
We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Agent who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with a background in banking or collections support to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
Minimum Qualifications: 

High school diploma or GED

Stable employment record

Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times

Schedule flexibility to work 40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends

Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner

Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check

Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
 
Preferred Skills:


Excellent computer abilities to navigate our care systems, as well as the Windows environment 

Ability to negotiate payment 

Strong problem solving skills

Basic data-entry and typing skills

Basic mathematical abilities
 
Preferred Qualifications:


Previous collections, call center or sales experience  Alliance Data card services

Job Description - Email Project Manager / Senior Digital Producer (0089705)Job Description Email Project Manager / Senior Digital Producer - (0089705) Epsilon is looking for a top-notch Senior Digital Producer/Project Manager to join our team. We are currently managing and deploying integrated marketing programs with a strong email and web focus for one of our larger accounts. The Senior Digital/Producer Project Manager will be the owner of day-to-day client relationships and delivery of client projects. This position will be working with a collaborative team composed of members from Epsilon at our San Francisco office or our client’s San Jose office.Key Areas of Responsibility• Proficient knowledge of project management lifecycles and best practices• Plan and manage projects from inception through deployment and ensure stringent quality control process followed for all deliverables• Juggle multiple projects simultaneously and seamlessly without error• Develop and execute project scopes, timelines, budgets, and staffing plans• Produce and maintain project documentation, including statements of work, meeting notes, technical documents, status reports, change management, and client approval documents• Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams of Strategy/Analytics, UX, Creative, Development/Production, and QA to make sure all deliverables are correctly executed and meet client expectations • Drive the project team to meet the agreed-upon timelines, maintaining the critical path and overseeing project finances• Communicate with internal and client teams effectively to ensure expectations are set and all deliverables are met on schedule• Demonstrate initiative and resourcefulness to meet project milestones, internal team needs, and client expectations• Construct clear, concise, and error-free written and verbal communications that provide the details required for project stakeholders• Manage and/or mentor junior project managers 
QualificationsThe candidate must have proven ability and qualifications in the following areas:• 6-8+ years of work experience in a client-side organization or marketing/advertising agency• 3-5+ years of project management and client services experience• Strong understanding with integrated, digital, web development and/or email marketing programs and technologies• Excellent client-facing skills including self-presentation and clarity of verbal and written communication. Able to negotiate and manage client concerns.• Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills required; able to identify solutions and ensure progress in the face of obstacles• Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and deliver results on time; graceful under pressure; able to thrive in a fluid and entrepreneurial environment• Experience working with various forms of Digital Marketing platforms and services• High-level proficiency in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project; proficiency in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Drive preferred• PMP certification is a plus• Bachelor's degree
