Job Description - Client Account Executive (0089538)Job Description Client Account Executive - (0089538) The Account Executive will work with other account team members in profitably managing and building client’s business. Account Executives are responsible for leading the day-to-day management and implementation of client programs and initiatives and ensuring flawless program execution. Integral to the success of this position is the ability to work with all levels and roles within the organization from production to creative to studio to accounting/finance and other account teams, as well as third-party vendors and service providers. 
 
Position Responsibilities:


Develop project briefs with client input, secure approvals and brief creative department. Ensure recommended work delivers against assignment brief.

Work with production, creative, and studio to ensure timely and accurate delivery of work based on the identified needs of the client.

Manage all program elements (working with Production when relevant) including budgets, timelines, contact reports, project implementation

Manage client approvals of project estimates and invoices and work with the client to update work status and discuss projects

Manage financial tracking and reporting by assisting account team with monthly job reconciliations 

Develop oral and written client presentations and/or communications

Assist with the Post-Program Evaluation (and such other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned from time to time)
Position Requirements


Bachelor’s Degree

a minimum of two years of relevant work experience

The ability to drive and/or assist on the steps necessary to get various programs launched

The ability to interface and communicate with the client

The ability to meet or exceed client expectations in the area of account management, industry/category/brand knowledge with a good understanding of industry channels and market conditions

Should have high standards, a strong work ethic and be able to function autonomously, while retaining team membership and spirit

Thorough and accurate communication ability

Ability to manage multiple priorities with strong organizational skills

Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs

Job Description - Client Account Executive (0089602)Job Description Client Account Executive - (0089602) PURPOSE
 
The Account Executive works closely with the account and project management team in the design and implementation of high volume direct marketing programs. The AE serves as a secondary resource for the development and management of project documentation including, but not limited to, project timelines, project overviews, open issues logs and project status reports and may manage small projects exclusively. This is an account management role and is not a sales position.
 
JOB DUTIES


Assists the Account Management team in the design and implementation of high volume direct marketing programs.

Assists the Account Supervisors, Account Directors and Senior Account Director with the development and maintenance of project open issues logs, project timelines, monthly reporting and status reports.

Works with internal team resources, such as Print Production, Creative and Data to initiate/execute programs, resolve issues and clarify requirements.

Review creative materials throughout the development process to ensure the proper integration and accuracy of content

Assist in obtaining both internal and external approvals of creative materials.

Assist in managing client and client expectations.

Manages small to medium sized projects and enhancements exclusively.
ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS


1-3 years of project/account management experience in the marketing services field, automotive client preferred

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising or related field or commensurate experience

Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks concurrently and prioritize tasks

Desire to work and thrive in a fast paced environment

Excellent leadership and organizational skills

Understands and able to apply basic project management principals. 

Strong oral and written communication skills

Performs effectively under short deadlines

Ability to assign priorities and meet delivery dates

High level of interpersonal skills to work effectively with all levels of management, teams, clients and vendors

Work collaboratively, emphasizing teamwork, diversity and knowledge sharing both within Epsilon and with external business partners

Analytical ability to resolve/clarify program related issues

Detail oriented for documentation of processes and effective follow-up

Exceptional knowledge of Microsoft Office Software: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook

Experience with Access, Visio, Project, or Adobe a plus.  Conditions of Employment

Job Description - Bilingual Call Center Representative - Spanish & English - Collections Agent (0089735)Job Description Bilingual Call Center Representative - Spanish & English - Collections Agent - (0089735) Entry Level Collections Agent
 
 
About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are.  
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Entry Level Collections Agents to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role contacting customers by phone through an automated dialing system who are between 1 – 3 months past due on their credit card accounts, to secure payment arrangements with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. And don’t worry, even if you don’t have the experience, we will provide you with all the resources and training you need to reach your true potential and career goals.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If you’re adaptable, assertive, and dependable, and this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, we definitely want to talk with you! Contact us today!

We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Representatives who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with the eagerness to learn and develop a career in collections to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
Minimum Qualifications: 
 
**Must be able to take and pass a Spanish bilingual assessment**
 
·         High school diploma or GED
·         Stable employment record
·         Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times
·         Schedule flexibility to work 30-40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends
·         Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner
·         Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check

Job Description - Campaign Operations Manager (0089670)Job Description Campaign Operations Manager - (0089670) Thanks for your interest in Conversant, an Epsilon company! Here’s the deal. You’re not just applying to some basic technology company. Rather you’re applying to a powerhouse that’s changing the face of an industry!  Conversant is committed to one simple but truly exciting principle: each person is different and every person matters. This mindset fuels everything we do for our clients and for each other. We do magic for our clients and we have fun doing it. If that sounds like your sort of place, we’d love to hear more from you.
About this RoleThe Campaign Operations Manager is responsible for hands on implementation of client’s campaigns, through the campaign's launch cycle (from setup through activation) to ensure best in market customer service and overall campaign success.  Working within a team of other Campaign Operations Managers, this individual serves as the point of execution for strategy, creative, and audience targeting on our proprietary online media campaign platforms.Core Responsibilities Monitor the ticketing queue and implement strategies for online media campaigns on behalf of our clients including campaign setup, ad/creative trafficking, troubleshooting and QAAssist Account Management, Media Delivery and other teams with understanding how campaigns can be setup and targeted into our proprietary ad serving systems across various pricing models (RTB, CPC, CPM), creative formats (mobile, desktop, video) and audience targets (location, gender, age, interests) Provide support for our proprietary ad serving systems to internal teams and external clients or ad serving vendors that involves in-depth knowledge of the system’s technology and behaviorConduct a light-QA of the campaign to ensure that all details are set up per the ticket request by creating test pages for client campaigns that can be reviewed and validated by internal teamsTroubleshoot various aspects of campaign setup including: hosted or 3rd party creative issues, impression pixels, click trackers, audience targeting and internal technical issuesCollaborate with Product Managers and Engineers to provide platform enhancement recommendations that improve workflow and user’s campaign implementation experienceExperience3+ years of experience with online media or production traffic and 1+ years of experience in ad operations/ad traffic role in an online marketing / rich-media advertising settingMust be able to multitask in a fast-paced ticketing system environmentAnalytical, tactical, and a detail-oriented self-starterKnowledge of Flash, JavaScript, SQL, MRAID and HTML a plusMust have knowledge of a variety of the financial and targeting concepts of the online advertising industry including but not limited to RTB, CPC, CPM, CPA, cookies, flight dates, creative sizes, ad servers, and attributes of user targetingPrevious experience with 3rd Party Ad Servers (Doubleclick, Atlas, Conversant Ad Server, Sizmek, etc.) or DSP/SSP Ad Servers, (Ad Exchanges, i.e. LiveRail, Doubleclick Bid Manager, etc.) a plus but not requiredPrevious customer service experience desiredPrevious experience with video file/formats or implementing video campaigns, a plusStrong team player with accountability and able to work in a highly collaborative environment Ability to think “outside the box” and quickly come up with solutions under pressureStrong written (tickets, email), verbal communication and interpersonal skillsAble to relay technical information (campaign implementation related) to non-technical peopleWorking knowledge of MS Office with specific understanding of Excel functions and featuresMust possess strong time management, follow-through and organizational skillsQualifications

2+ years of experience with online media or production traffic and 1+ years of experience in ad operations/ad traffic role or quality assurance in an online marketing / rich-media advertising business.
Bachelor Degree
 
Apply directly to jshaughnessy@conversantmedia.comLI*JS

Job Description - Marketing Program Manager / Senior Account Executive (0089572)Job Description Marketing Program Manager / Senior Account Executive - (0089572) Qualifications & Responsibilities 
The Senior Account Executive (SAE) oversees and manages the workflow and execution of various multi-channel marketing campaigns. The SAE works within the account team to execute activities for our automotive client accounts. SAE responsibilities include:

Creates presentations, sets up meetings and communicate with clients and account team
Lead in project planning and scheduling
Internal and external quotes and approvals
Develop pricing and profit calculations and approvals
Develop and manage launch and production schedules
Manage all project workflow with production teams
Coordinate outside vendor production
Pursue and process approvals from account team, clients and production teams
Communicate project status and changes with account team, clients and production team
Prepare data processing specifications and perform audits
Assist in managing the workflow of projects from sales through production and close
Ensure client sign-off on all phases of production
Provide proofing and audit of campaign materials and deliverables
Update client status reports
Assists in resolving problems with projects
Manage all cost tracking and ensure project is billed correctly
Process invoices and procure approvals on a timely basis
Process and distribute daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, or annual reports to internal and external customers
Coordinate postage funds, request postage invoices and complete postage reconciliations
Prepare data processing specifications and perform audits
Ensure client sign-off on all phases of production
Update client status reports
Develop and compile competitive reviews
Manage direct marketing campaigns at appropriate levels
Serve as liaison between client and creative, production, and data
Prepare well-organized, clear and concise memos, conference reports and documentation
Track program results and generates response reports
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications

BS degree in Business, Marketing or Communications, or comparable experience
5 – 10 years of experience in related account role
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Able to work independently; self-starter, with strong initiative
Highly organized and detail-oriented, while coordinating multiple projects simultaneously
A strong MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint expertise is a must
SalesForce.com application experience a plus
Must be familiar with the use of presentations, meeting minutes, and status reports
Automotive marketing experience a plus

Job Responsibilities
 
As a Customer Service Representative, you will deliver a unique customer service experience utilizing your effective questioning and listening skills to anticipate and determine the customer’s needs and concerns, to ensure a high level of customer satisfaction. This will involve, answering incoming calls and assisting customers as needed by properly handling account inquiries, complaints, and providing solutions in courteous and timely manner. And don’t worry, even if you don’t have the experience, we will provide you with all the resources and training you need to reach your true potential and career goals.
 
Specific duties for this call center CSR role include, but are not limited to:
 

Using our computer system and customer care guidelines with your listening and problem-solving skills to investigate and fix customer’s issues

Updating the computer system during and each call to keep our systems up to date
Striving to achieve or exceed goals through teamwork within a friendly competitive environment
Maintaining composure when handling escalated/difficult calls
Maintaining a high level of attention to details

maintain the server infrastructure. You will interact with almost every
department inside the company to ensure that the critical infrastructure is
running at peak performance. Overseeing the deployment of new environments
while streamlining procedures to maximize efficiency.

Chassis)Dell Server Management platform (iDRAC)Experience working in a support capacity with Dell rack and
blade serversFamiliar with Open Source PlatformsDemonstrated troubleshooting skills through resolution;
understanding problem from the network, OS, and application levelsSuperb documentation skills Ability to communicate clearly and concisely with service
partners and vendorsAbility to be on call on a rotating basisExcellent organization skills, project tracking abilities,
communications skills, and time management skills

























Preferred
Qualifications  

RHCSA, LFCSA, Linux + or equivalent preferred but not
requiredExperience in an Administration or NOC environment in a
plus.College Degree or equivalent experienceThis is for a 24/7/365 environment, the possibility of

Job Description - Sr. Software Engineer, Big Data (0085597)Job Description Sr. Software Engineer, Big Data - (0085597) We may be one of the most important Internet companies
you've never heard of. Our mission is to make every digital display, mobile or
video ad on the Internet able, if the user permits, to be made more personal and
valuable by informing it with anonymous user data.

Conversant software engineers are developing the
next-generation of ad tech that is changing the way marketers connect and
interact with their consumers. Our systems need to handle information at global
scale, from processing petabytes of data daily to making bid decisions in under
20 ms over a million times per second at peak.

The Data
Warehousing department at Conversant is responsible for brokering all
enterprise data and maintaining database and Hadoop environments at petabyte
scale on an ever changing technology stack.  In this role, in addition to
mastering the technology stack, it is also of vital importance to develop
subject matter expertise on the enterprise’s data set.  As a data driven
company, the way we capture, store and utilize the corporate asset of the
proprietary data model is what drives our best in class understanding of the
consumer and equates directly to the company’s bottom line.

 

Responsibilities:

 

You will design and code solutions
for providing low-latency, high-throughput data persistence solutions for our
industry-leading ad server platform. Sling Java code that process
billions of records across large distributed clusters.You design, develop, test, deploy,
maintain, and enhance software solutions. 





 

Qualifications:

At least 6 years of experience in
developing client-server applicationsAt least 2 years of experience in
leading projects preferredExpert level Java preferredExcellent understanding of
multithreaded applicationsAbility to learn and investigate new
areas independently









 

Preferred
Skills

Experience with specific “big data” technologies including
Hadoop, HBase, Storm, Kafka, Spark.Experience with distributed systems handling large scale data
sets.Experience developing high
frequency/low latency applicationsExperience developing Real Time
Bidding or Ad Tech applications.BS
     or MS in Computer Science + relevant real world experience.

Job Description - Entry Level Collections Agent - Call Center Representative (0089739)Job Description Entry Level Collections Agent - Call Center Representative - (0089739) Entry Level Collections Agent
 
 
About Us
 
If you are you ready to take your next big career step with a respected leading provider of tailored marketing and loyalty solutions, then join us at Alliance Data! As providers of branded credit cards for top companies, it’s easy to assume we’re simply a bank – but the truth is, we’re so much more than that. Rather than building our portfolio, we focus on growing our partners’ sales. Our team of experts is on the cutting edge of marketing, loyalty and data-driven insights – making us relationship builders who drive results and create connections. That’s deliberately different, and that’s exactly who we are.  
 
Due to our continued success, we are seeking results-driven and customer service-oriented Entry Level Collections Agents to join our growing team. In this position, you will play a key role contacting customers by phone through an automated dialing system who are between 1 – 3 months past due on their credit card accounts, to secure payment arrangements with the purpose of bringing their accounts current. And don’t worry, even if you don’t have the experience, we will provide you with all the resources and training you need to reach your true potential and career goals.
 
At Alliance Data, we consider ourselves to be a family – one that works hard together, supports each other and motivates each other. It’s all rooted in our culture – one that embraces inclusion and diversity while empowering each associate to progress personally and professionally. If you’re adaptable, assertive, and dependable, and this sounds like the career move you’ve been waiting to make, we definitely want to talk with you! Contact us today!
 
“What’s in it for you?”
 
·         Competitive Compensation + performance-based incentives!
·         Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
·         Fitness reimbursement and wellness programs
·         401(k) with company match
·         Employee stock purchase plan
·         Paid time off
·         Back-up child care
·         Tuition reimbursement
·         A dynamic and innovative work environment
·         Countless career and development opportunities
·         And so much more!
 
 
   Job Requirements
 
We are looking for adaptable and dependable Collections Call Center Representatives who combine a passion for providing quality customer service with the eagerness to learn and develop a career in collections to secure payment arrangements. You should also have the time-management and organizational skills necessary to effectively handle multiple expectations and thrive in a performance-based call center environment. It is also vital that you display exceptional verbal and written communication, negotiation and active-listening skills, as well as the ability to easily establish rapport and credibility with a variety of customers.
 
Minimum Qualifications: 
 
·         High school diploma or GED
·         Stable employment record
·         Ability to maintain outstanding attendance at all times
·         Schedule flexibility to work 30-40 hours per week including days, evenings and weekends
·         Ability to effectively communicate in a respectful and assertive manner
·         Willingness to submit to and pass E-Verify and background check
·         Ability to feel comfortable sitting for most of an 8h shift
 
Preferred Skills:
·         Excellent computer abilities to navigate our care systems, as well as the Windows environment 
·         Ability to negotiation payment 
·         Strong problem solving skills
·         Basic data-entry and typing skills
·         Basic mathematical abilities
 
Preferred Qualifications:
·         Previous collections, call center or sales experience
 
 

Entry Level Collections Agent – Call Center Representative 
(Full Time / Customer Service / Accounting / Finance)

Job Description - Sr. Art Director, Marketing Creative (0089713)Job Description Sr. Art Director, Marketing Creative - (0089713) 
Thanks for your interest
in Conversant, an Epsilon company!  Here’s the deal. You’re
not just applying to some basic technology company. Rather you’re applying to a
powerhouse that’s changing the face of an industry! We couldn’t have done
any of that without our team of superstars and a culture that celebrates each
one of them. Individuals matter just as much within our walls as they do in the
1:1 marketing programs we create for clients. Here’s what we believe in at
Conversant: 
 Excellence – We
     work toward perfection in all that we do, and we do not settle for second
     best.
 Passion – We
     enjoy what we do, and our teamwork, drive and focus help us discover just
     how good we can be.
 Service – We
     delight our client partners by providing exceptional value and
     unparalleled service.
 Integrity – We
     are open, honest, trustworthy and respectful with clients, our co-workers
     and our community.
 Leadership – We
     are leaders, not followers.
 Ownership – We
     are accountable and responsible for our client’s success.
 New Ideas – We
     initiate change to improve our business, products, services and solutions.
 The individual we’re
looking for has a sophisticated, clean, modern design aesthetic – a mix of Paul
Rand and Swiss Design of the 1940s meets the latest user experience and modern
technical iconography. Key requirements for this role include creative strategy
and flawless execution of design principles including layout, typography and
composition to support business “practice areas,” as well as overall marketing
communications. Works very closely with Marketing and Creative to support the
accurate and timely delivery of all content deliverables. This is a perfect
position for those seeking “client side” career.
 
  
   
  
 
Responsibilities: Creative Strategy: Work with internal marketing clients to
develop creative strategy and flawless execution of marketing and sales
collateral. Successfully communicate design ideas with a strong POV, both
verbally and visually. Understand client’s creative briefs, problem-solve and
troubleshoot various design issues and challenges. Design Execution: Drive the conceptual and stylistic
direction to flawlessly execute design deliverables to support campaigns.
Maintain creative excellence, while striving for ways to improve innovation and
scalability. Blow us away with your work that helps shape a new industry. Technical Proficiency
& Industry Knowledge: Demonstrate
proficiency in Microsoft Office and Adobe Creative Cloud (CC) and latest trends
in design and evolving digital landscape. SKILLS
& ABILITIES:


Above
all else, translate concepts of creative strategy into meaningful pieces of art
that live at the same time in a complex matrix of mediums.Ensure
visual communication standards are met.Excellent
communication and collaboration skills.Drive
work with exceptional problem-solving skills, time/project management and
organizational ability.Knowledge
of web/digital/video design principles.Exposure
or experience with front-end development a plus, but not required.Mentor
and help lead seasoned team of creatives REQUIREMENTS:Your
portfolio should include brand work (B2B, a plus), as well as corporate
communications.Education:
Minimum Bachelors Degree in Graphic Design, Fine Arts or other discipline.Years
of Experience: 8+  PROGRAM
KNOWLEDGE:Adobe
Creative CloudMac/PC
platform literate

Job Description - Account Manager, Associate (0089543)Job Description Account Manager, Associate - (0089543) 
Do you want to work in a fun, smart, and energetic environment where you will be challenged, rewarded AND inspired? Come work with top performers at CJ Affiliate to make a real difference in how top brands run their businesses. We are the world’s leading affiliate marketing network - we transform digital marketing with the help of big data and business intelligence.   We help advertisers drive more sales and expand their reach … and we want to hear from you!.
 
Associate Account Managers play a key role in support of CJ's advertisers. They are responsible for maintaining all publisher relationships of behalf of the advertiser and are responsible for creating and executing recruitment and optimization campaigns. They contribute to the development of an affiliate marketing strategy for each advertiser, and are directly responsible for ensuring the successful execution of that strategy, including managing Account Representatives in their tactical execution.
 
Do these things interest you? You will:

Recruit, manage and develop publisher relationships on behalf of advertisers, communicating expectations, sharing best practices, disseminating offers and promotions, and providing account updates to an advertiser's largest/most important publishers.
Participate in building and presenting the advertiser strategy presentations and quarterly business reviews of results.
Identify new sources of revenue on behalf of advertisers by extending reach through new publisher relationships or optimizing affiliate marketing campaign strategies.
Lead recruitment and optimization components of weekly client calls, documenting and disseminating assigned tasks across client and CJ account teams, and ensuring successful execution of assigned tasks.
Train and develop Account Representatives, as well as leading their efforts to successfully execute tactical components of affiliate marketing campaigns.
Identify opportunities to better optimize campaign results by interpreting standard and custom reports
 
What we look for:

Bachelor's Degree and minimum of 2 years’ experience in the online marketing industry-ideally digital performance marketing.
Clear and effective communication and can convey complex results in a simple, clear manner, using solid business acumen, demonstrating a competent level command of digital marketing concepts.
Ability to influence/develop account strategies that leverage analysis and insights to contribute to meeting or exceeding advertiser objectives.
Ability to execute a variety of tasks within designated time frames, delivering exceptional quality results and are able to directly contribute to the formation of client campaigns and quarterly business results.
Results oriented problem solver
Proficient knowledge of the Microsoft suite of products including Windows, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

  


Why CJ Affiliate? 
CJ Affiliate is the leader in Affiliate Marketing.  We take pride in our innovative technology, comprehensive data solutions and our people.  We equip our teams with advanced tools, training and career development opportunities all to provide cutting edge solutions, strategies and support to deliver high quality results for our clients. We work in an energetic, results-oriented, collaborative, team environment that recognizes exceptional performance. As we evolve and grow as a business, so do you.          
We offer comprehensive benefits including; competitive compensation, aggressive 401K match program, health and dental insurance, flexible time off, an Employee Stock purchase plan, fitness membership reimbursement, backup care program, flexible spending accounts, charitable donation matching and much, much more!  Our benefits are designed to care for you and your family – to keep you healthy - physically, emotionally, financially and socially.  
CJ Affiliate is a business unit within Conversant and Epsilon which is part of Alliance Data, a top performing Fortune 500 company also included in the S&P 500- NYSE: ADS.

Job Description - Agency - Direct Mail Program Manager / Senior Account Executive (0089259)Job Description Agency - Direct Mail Program Manager / Senior Account Executive - (0089259) Senior Account Executive The Senior Account Executive will manage tactical execution of programs as well as manage client relationships relative to those programs. Both direct mail and email programs may be part of the SAE responsibility. The Senior Account Executive will serve as the primary day-to-day contact with clients and coordinate with onsite tactical staff. 
Primary Senior Account Executive Responsibilities:• Client-facing role• Oversee creative development and execution of campaigns• Manage list requirements, strategy documentation, flight plans and timelines for multiple projects• Manage relationships with both internal partners and external partners to provide exceptional client service• Obtain client and internal approvals as appropriate on all materials• Review all creative, development and vendor proofs as appropriate• Verify and confirm all billing and project costs – manages budget for individual programs• Work closely with Account Supervisor
Additional Day-to-Day Responsibilities Include:• Oversees implementation of all projects ensuring accurate, efficient and timely execution.• Ensures that all client requests are handled in a timely manner.• Develops insightful, thought-provoking Creative Briefs. Leads the creative team in the development and execution of creative concepts.• Possesses an in-depth knowledge of the client’s business and product lines and utilize that knowledge to establish credibility with clients 
Background/Skills Required:• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing or Communications.• 3+ years of Direct Marketing experience preferred. • Manage direct marketing programs for one or more client programs, including strategic planning, project execution and results analysis. Strong emphasis on direct mail and email programs.• Excellent written & verbal communication skills.• Candidate must work well in a fast paced, deadline oriented environment; have very good attention to detail; and must be able to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.• MS Excel, Word and PowerPoint expertise.

Job Description - Data Developer 2 / ETL (0089524)Job Description Data Developer 2 / ETL - (0089524) The Developer II (Data Analysis) works with the Lead Developer to design and develop technical solutions on a proprietary, multi-node computing environment focused on 'big data' processing (billions of records).   
 
This requires full SDLC familiarity, including requirements review, analysis, design, programming, testing and implementation as assigned.
 
Responsibilities

Verify input data quality, including identification and communication of file variances and potential issues
Read data file dumps and QC conversion output.
Set up, process and QC data hygiene and merge/purge processes
Set up and process statistical reports and provide these reports to account teams.
Maintain and adhere to project schedules.
Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent years of experience required
1-3 years of development experience required 
Proven analysis, design, programming and implementation experience is required 
Experience manipulating and joining multiple, large data files (Millions of records, 100’s of GB) required.
Knowledge of data formats – character fields, packed fields, binary, hexadecimal fields required.
Experience with flat files, Ascii/Ebcdic, binary data, bitmapping, and ETL processing fundamental.  
Knowledge and understanding of HADOOP, cloud computing, massively parallel-processing systems strongly preferred.
Knowledge of UNIX environment/directory structures /Linux/DO environment is helpful
Experience with data compression algorithms and techniques preferred.
Development experience with C, C++, Perl, Shell Scripting preferred
Experience with database programs and basic SQL Knowledge and preferred
Familiarity with Agile Development concepts, JIRA, and GIT
Ability to solve problems without using traditional tools, software, or relational databases.
Knowledge of data hygiene, address standardization, etc is a plus.
Strong written and oral communications skills
Ability to read, create, and change existing code
Ability to coordinate and follow up with multiple tasks
Attention to detail necessary
Ability to recommend and implement automation solutions for production process.

Job Description - Senior Developer (0089223)Job Description Senior Developer - (0089223) Summary
This position provides ongoing production support for the automotive marketing platform.  The position’s purpose includes, but is not limited to:

Setup/configuration of the production system.
Daily monitor and support for the production system
Communication with development, product and account management teams etc. to address issues/concerns.
Operation of data systems to export data to the third-party systems
Development work for automation of operational tasks.
Support system patch or version upgrade
Assist with reporting tasks
Duties and responsibilities

Supports the initial review and analysis of Help Desk Tickets, as per Problem Management procedures. Debug and trouble shoot production issues.
Develops and implements solutions in accordance with policies and procedures.
Facilitate the design and implementation process for new products/projects, and evaluates impacts on the operation, informing senior executive of alternatives.
Analyze user requests and assist with design from support perspective.
Provide in-depth and strong technical specialty and knowledge to the team.
Develop structures, forms and outputs based on business and/or application requirements
Coordinate and conduct tests and project implementations, for the Team, under the direction of superiors.  Administer full project documentation efforts in accordance with policy and procedure
Advise, and mentor team members in the specialized technical areas as well as fulfill administrative duties as defined by support process
Perform root cause analysis (RCA)
Work with cross-functional teams during crisis to address and resolve complex incidents and problems in addition to assessment, analysis, and resolution of cross-functional issues.
Recognizes and identifies potential areas where existing policies and procedures associated with support requires improvement and helps in the process improvement activity.
Work with the Incident Monitoring and Escalation Processes and ensures that appropriate escalation of all support related issues.
Collect data and develop metrics to report on performance against future defined Service Level Agreements and targets, and analyzes deviations from the agreed service levels and suggests actions/improvements.
Develop Metrics to Assess & Improve Production Support services organization utilizing Continual Service Improvement methodologies. Metrics will be trended to show improvement or decline of service.
Update/create Knowledge Base Articles and case studies as necessary.  Assist in the creation and improvement of Knowledge Management
Qualifications
 
Minimum qualifications

Developer with 6+ years of experience required. 
Excellent skills in Oracle and Microsoft SQL Server databases, and respective procedural languages (PL/SQL and T-SQL).
Strong working knowledge in Unix environment and capable of Unix Shell and PowerShell scripting. 
Experience with C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS preferable.
Familiar with Application Development Life Cycle and be able to independently participate in each components.
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or equivalent
Preferred qualifications

Non-Technical:

Good Analytical and problem solving skills.
Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot problems quickly to maintain operational stability.
Motivated to learn new applications and domain.
Possess appetite for learning through exploration and reverse engineering. 
Strong time management skills.
Ability to take full ownership of tasks and projects.
Behavioral Attributes:

Team player with excellent interpersonal skills. 
Good verbal and written communication.
Possess Can-Do attitude to overcome any kind of challenges.

Job Description - Technical Project Manager (0085443)Job Description Technical Project Manager - (0085443) The Project Manager is responsible for defining, planning, and directing multiple enterprise level Software Development and Information Technology projects. The person filling this role must have experience leading cross-functional teams in both Agile with Scrum and Traditional SDLC environments. A solid technical background, keen analytical skills, proficiency at written communication, as well as interpersonal and organizational skills are required.
 
The successful candidate will manage cross-functional teams in the planning, execution, and delivery of high quality products in both Agile with Scrum and traditional SDLC environments. Proactively drive the full software development life cycle from inception through post-production including planning, scheduling, and control of projects.  The candidate will also report to the Automotive Project Management Office (PMO) and have functions, such as but not limited to tools management, process documentations, project metrics and reporting.
 
Responsibilities


Effectively monitor progress against project plans, identifying risks, issues, and mitigation strategies. Create detailed schedules, burn down and velocity charts, project progress reports, and other deliverables essential to project execution and control.
Coordinate development and delivery activities among various project participants and stakeholders.
Manage project scope, schedules, issues, risks, and resources in support of all project activities.
Daily interactions with the Program/Product Management, Product Development and Account teams
Create, maintain and publish the Program Development Plan (PDP) that communicates tasks, milestone dates, status and resource allocation to key business stakeholders
Manage changes to the Plan through effective participation in change control processes
Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documentation
Track Production Releases to ensure releases are on track and client UATs are scheduled
Participate in CPDP (cross-program development program) meetings for project prioritization
Mentor other team members on project management techniques and deliverables.
Play a proactive role in the promotion of project management methods and standards, implementation of good project management practice, and the monitoring of certain projects
Improve the planning and delivery process by collecting and maintaining data in a consistent form

Required Qualifications


3+ years as a Project Manager in Software Development or Information Technology
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required (Computer Science or closely related field preferred).
Excellent communication and relationship skills
Strong analytical, decision-making, and prioritization skills
Able to work independently and as part of a team
Very detail oriented and organized
Able to work in a dynamic, fast paced environment
Expertise with Microsoft Office suite
Project management "tool" experience such as Microsoft Project, Rally or JIRA

Preferred Qualifications 


PMP and/or Scrum Master Certification
Microsoft Team Foundation Server 2010 (TFS) and Visual Studio 2010 experience
Knowledge of CRM Applications, Content Management, Web, CSS, ASP.net, APIs, SQL and Oracle Databases, Salesforce.com or PeopleSoft
Experience with Requirement Management and/or Program Management tools
Automotive Industry knowledge  Conditions of Employment

Job Description - Senior Director, Marketing Technology (0089643)Job Description Senior Director, Marketing Technology - (0089643) Epsilon is seeking a Senior Director, Marketing Technology with a proven track record in designing, delivering, and managing complex Marketing Technology and CRM/Loyalty engagements involving both interactive technologies and database technologies. Candidates should have a strong grasp of technical underpinnings of large transactional systems and web architectures, database architecture, data modeling, and system integration. He or she should also have solid grasp of marketing concepts and can display the insight and know how to apply technology to meet client’s marketing needs. In addition, the candidate should have strong communication (written and oral) skills and able to collaborate with senior-level client and Epsilon stakeholders.
 
Responsibilities:

Managing teams (including direct, indirect and matrixed) and project timelines for build and manage environments.
Must be able to lead teams supporting more than 1 client. 
Research and propose cost effective marketing technology solutions to address business challenges such as improvement of development, processes and governance standards.
Participate in new business development opportunities by contributing to pricing and solution design.
Provide technology delivery leadership in the organization.
Performing resource management, forecasting, leadership, and teambuilding.
Provide guidance to client service team on technical capabilities, staffing and infrastructure needs. Proactively identify and address project risks.
Empower and guide team through multiple releases
Identify efficiencies and improve the Software Development Lifecycle
Enforce a high standard of operational excellence and compliance.
Managing the quality and timeliness of update and deliverables.
Ensure that production procedure, change management, documentation and control are followed and continuously enhanced.
Serve as first-line of escalation from the project delivery teams on major operations issues and delivery challenges.
Meet with external clients to review account performance, resolve delivery issues and plan future phases of work.
Manage career paths by coaching and mentoring direct and indirect reports. Contribute to design and continue improvement of our marketing platforms.
Travel to client location between 25% (average) and up to 50% (for specific phases)
Qualifications:

Strong client interfacing background required
Ideally some experience in a consulting role from a systems integration perspective  
Proven ability to mentor/motivate reports and team members
Ability to communicate complex marketing technology concepts to marketers
Overall work experience of 14+ years
5+ years of Delivery Leadership experience
10+ years’ experience with software implementation from requirement through discovery/define, design, development, client acceptance, launch and manage
Strong experience in iterative delivery methodology
10+ years’ experience in digital/web technologies - ASP.net (preferred) or J2EE and relational/no-SQL platforms – Oracle (preferred), IBM, Cassandra, etc
Preferred: Working knowledge of marketing tool stack (Adobe, IBM, Oracle) and CRM databases (SalesForce, etc) and loyalty engines
Strong knowledge of deploying and managing systems in public cloud such as AWS that can scale on demand
Demonstrated experience leading a team of between 20+ individuals distributed over multiple locations in different time zones
Has built highly scalable data-driven web/digital applications that source data from multiple source systems
Ability to handle program management across multiple concurrent initiatives
BS in Computer Science or related discipline

Job Description - Manager, Credit Bureau Disputes (0089826)Job Description Manager, Credit Bureau Disputes - (0089826) Qualifications & Responsibilities
 
Defines and manages business strategies and governance for Credit Bureau Disputes.  Responsibilities include: ownership for the documented process for credit bureau direct and indirect disputes, ensuring the accuracy and integrity of our dispute responses to the credit bureaus and cardholders, establish and maintain audit and control processes, ensure adherence to regulatory and compliance requirements including the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Metro II Industry reporting guidelines, and utilization e-Oscar.
 


Manages, defines and documents business policy strategies for credit bureau disputes.  This includes:

Core business strategies

Develop and enhance internal Operational procedures.  

Conduct regular oversight on Credit Bureau Dispute procedures for consistency and gaps relative to regulations in addition to impacts on customer experience.

Develops procedural implementation and change management process with Operations to ensure proper governance and controls exist.

Adherence to industry standards and regulatory and compliance requirements

CBR Dispute leader in Operations dotted line reporting to this Manager for strategy execution. 
 
Works closely with the Credit Bureau Dispute and Credit Bureau Reporting teams to identify gaps.


Work with Care Center leaders to execute the established business strategies.

Formalize Credit Bureau Dispute audit and control processes, and communication on identified areas opportunities.  

Align Credit Bureau Dispute procedures with Credit Bureau Reporting processes.             
 
Owns credit bureau dispute trending, understanding of industry best practices, peer analysis and clear understanding of regulatory expectations.  


Responsible for identifying regulatory changes that affect Credit Bureau Disputes. 

Proactively provides input and recommendations to key stakeholders and leaders on specific areas of concern, impacts to the business, and recommendations to drive process improvements and efficiencies to maximize accuracy and mitigate risks.
                
Works directly with the Care Center for continued educational opportunities for credit bureau dispute policy and procedures, industry best practices, and targeted training as necessary based on identified gaps and trends.   
 
Qualifications:



Proven working knowledge of Metro 2 guidelines

FCRA and Metro 2 certifications

Proven performance in leading internal and external teams to drive solutions

Results oriented with ability to bring teams together to achieve strategic goals.

Proven Knowledge of Credit Bureau Reporting and Metro II

Proven Knowledge of e-Oscar

Professional Demeanor with superior interpersonal communication skills (verbal and written)

Ability to formulate and implement a vision for credit bureau disputes

Ability to build relationships and interact with senior level leaders and external partners.

Strong organizational skills with the ability to establish priorities and meet deadlines.

Ability to demonstrate strong reasoning and analytical skills

Ability to identify, research, and resolve problems or  provide recommendations 

Ability to maintain confidential information.

Ability to identify and resolve problems.

Aptitude for detail and accuracy.

Ability to exercise initiative and sound judgment.

requirements from internal stakeholders and independently builds solutions

The projects vary from campaign measurement design to new product report
prototyping and development.  The Senior Analyst develop original code to

troubleshooting of existing products and tools developed by the Analytics team.

     mentor others

Prior work
experience:  

1-2 years
     of industry experience with a Master's Degree or 3+ years of work experience

Job Description - Associate Project Manager (0089813)Job Description Associate Project Manager - (0089813) Associate Project Manager
 
Epsilon is an all-encompassing global marketing innovator.  We provide unrivaled data intelligence and customer insights, world-class technology including loyalty, email and CRM platforms and data-driven creative, activation and execution. With over 40 years in the market, we help Fortune 500 companies across numerous industries better connect with their consumers, online and offline, and improve their marketing, day in and day out. We have been recognized by Forbes as one of “America’s Best Employers to Work For,” a top company by Fortune Magazine as one of the “100 Best Places to Work for Millennials,” and have earned the Ad Age accolade of “#1 U.S. Agency Across all Disciplines” for multiple years. 
 
Epsilon is seeking an Associate Project Manager (APM) to participate in our New Grad Program. As an APM, you will support Project and Account Teams in the management of design and implementation of digital solutions for our clients. You will be taught how to manage projects and clients through a variety of project management tasks, from the management of small design and email production projects to the management of maintenance projects for existing clients as well as support on more complex, high-volume, high-visibility digital marketing programs and websites. A successful APM candidate will be an organized person who likes the challenge of reining in chaos as much as you enjoy proactively and methodically executing tasks.
 
As a participant in the New Grad Program, you will have the opportunity to fast-track your career with Epsilon. The program includes a 12-week training curriculum (both professional & technical training), a formal mentoring partnership, various networking opportunities (speed networking events, leader meet & greets, group lunches and social events), and long-term career guidance.
 
Responsibilities May Include (All or Some) Tasks Below:


Work closely with the Project Manager or Account team & the clients to support the management of email programs

Drive the project team to meet the agreed-upon timelines as agreed upon, maintaining the critical path

Escalate issues to Project Manager or Account Team that cannot be resolved within the project teams when those issues ultimately impact the schedule and/or project deliverables

Hold or support regular team meetings to manage schedule, obtain updates, discuss issues, and resolve problems with the project

Communicate major milestones and priorities, as well as bottlenecks and other problems, which affect a successful delivery

Prepare project documentation, including meeting notes, status reports, and change management and client approval documents

Ensure that project teams input hours, run weekly reports on project burn, and present reports to Account Team or Client Partner 
Qualifications: 

Bachelor’s degree with Technical and/or Marketing concentration preferred
1–2 years’ work experience in a professional office environment

1+ year of advertising, marketing or web-related experience; experience at a creative agency is a plus
0-1+ year of project management or project coordination experience involving development and deployment of consumer- or business-oriented websites and/or web-based applications
Maturity to lead multifunctional teams, interact with clients, & remain graceful under pressure
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills required; able to drive decisions and ensure progress in the face of obstacles
Proven ability to juggle multiple priorities while maintaining high-quality work & deliver results on time
High-level proficiency in Microsoft Office; proficiency in Google Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Drive preferred
Excellent listening & communication skills, both verbal and written
Able to work in a team & build effective relationships
Demonstrated leadership skills
Self-starter, with strong initiative  Conditions of Employment 
All job offers are contingent upon successful completion of certain background checks which unless prohibited by applicable law may include criminal history checks, employment verification, education verification, drug screens, credit checks, DMV checks (for driving positions only) and fingerprinting.

Job Description - Senior Compensation Analyst (0089759)Job Description Senior Compensation Analyst - (0089759) The Senior Compensation Analyst is charged with supporting the organizations Compensation programs, processes and strategy to ensure that Epsilon employees are being compensated at an optimal level, aligned with our strategy and externally competitive.  The Sr. Analyst will be called upon to support and may lead certain project activities such as merit, salary surveys or supporting FLSA/DOL requirements.  As well as providing day to day support for the assigned business units or departments related to job wage and salary classification.
 
 
Responsibilities

Conducts analyses of jobs, hourly wages, salaries, and incentives in order to evaluate internal equity, external competitiveness, and legal compliance of the company's pay practices.
Sr. Analyst will conduct job analyses and recommend appropriate salary grades or market rates for specific jobs according to market driven guidelines.
Participates in salary surveys to collect and analyze competitive salary information to determine company's competitive position.
Evaluates jobs for content and prepares job descriptions reflecting job responsibilities, activities, duties and requirements.
The Sr. Analyst will be expected to summarize data, and provide management with succinct analysis and recommendations in both written and verbal formats.
Position may be called upon to support creation of new positions in HRIS system.
Will review requests for new or revised jobs or classifications to determine appropriate salary grade assignment.
Formulates recommendations regarding development of company salary structure, FLSA exemptions, job revisions and organizational structures.
Generates reports as requested using data from HRIS system downloads. Assists in the generation and analysis of compression analyses, market adjustment reports, out-of-range reports, exemption change reports, or other compensation-related analyses.
Develops, edits, and distributes training, presentation, and other materials for compensation program roll-outs.
Prepares data files to upload to the HRIS, as well as any other necessary HR software packages.
Reviews requests for job analysis, including requests for new job titles or changes to existing jobs’ job descriptions, and approves changes if necessary.
Regularly evaluates salary structure (including pay grades and ranges) and compensation policies; recommends changes based on salary survey data and internal equity.
Prepares special studies and recommendations on subjects such as incentive compensation, bonus plans, sales compensation or stock options.
Advises management on compensation actions for employees.
May review and/or approve job transfers and promotions to ensure appropriate titles and levels are assigned to all employees based on the work required, prior experience, and other criteria
Develops, implements, and administers compensation policies and programs.
The ideal candidate for this role will have experience with sales plan design (including modeling) and documentation.
 
Qualifications

5-7 years compensation experience as a requirement
Bachelors degree preferred
CCP or progress towards CCP required
Able to communicate effectively with internal and external customer of all levels, including Executives.
Able to maintain data integrity through attention to detail and accuracy, prioritize and meet aggressive deadlines, and process, manipulate, and summarize reports.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint required
Ability to work in a fast paced, global technology firm 
A strong understanding of HRIS systems and relational databases.
A broad understanding of the entire Human Resources discipline.
Excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, project management, decision-making, and time management skills.
Strong skills in MS Office applications.

Job Description - Senior Vice President, Sales (0089379)Job Description Senior Vice President, Sales - (0089379) About the Opportunity
 
The Senior Vice President of Sales will develop, drive, and lead new business opportunities for Epsilon’s Services. The Sales executive will support prospective and existing accounts and will also have responsibilities for building and leading the sales organization. 
 
Successful candidates will bring a strong functional skill base, a track record of delivering results, and good interpersonal and organizational skill sets.
Duties & Responsibilities


Interfaces with client at all levels within existing and prospective account(s)

Consults with customers to fully understand their needs

Identifies and leads the pursuit of the targeted new business and contract expansion opportunities within target accounts

Leverages a client-diagnostic sales strategy and consultative approach to uncover client specific issues and/or opportunities

Identifies and manages resources to develop proposals that position the full range of Epsilon’s capabilities and solutions to customers

Collaborates with Epsilon’s executive team and subject matter experts to jointly present proposals

Monitors delivery, implementation, and customer satisfaction 
Preferred Qualifications


10 years of relevant experience within a Relationship/Direct Marketing setting

A solid understanding of technology and marketing programs is essential

Knowledge of direct to consumer and direct to practitioner marketing programs

Strong consultative selling focus, with a track record of developing opportunities and closing business preferably within the pharmaceutical or healthcare space

Strong business, communication, and presentation skills

Organized with the ability to manage and track multiple priorities

Project/customer relationship management a strength

Ability to collaborate effectively with others across the organization to accomplish team goals

Track record in managing sales personnel and mentoring less experienced members of sales team on selling, account management and negotiations skills

Drive to deliver value to clients and to help shape and build a fast-paced, growing organization   Conditions of Employment

Job Description - Senior Director, Marketing Technology (0089731)Job Description Senior Director, Marketing Technology - (0089731) Epsilon is seeking a Senior Director, Marketing Technology with a proven track record in designing, delivering, and managing complex Marketing Technology and CRM/Loyalty engagements involving both interactive technologies and database technologies. Candidates should have a strong grasp of technical underpinnings of large transactional systems and web architectures, database architecture, data modeling, and system integration. He or she should also have solid grasp of marketing concepts and can display the insight and know how to apply technology to meet client’s marketing needs. In addition, the candidate should have strong communication (written and oral) skills and able to collaborate with senior-level client and Epsilon stakeholders.
 
Responsibilities:

Managing teams (including direct, indirect and matrixed) and project timelines for build and manage environments.
Must be able to lead teams supporting more than 1 client. 
Research and propose cost effective marketing technology solutions to address business challenges such as improvement of development, processes and governance standards.
Participate in new business development opportunities by contributing to pricing and solution design.
Provide technology delivery leadership in the organization.
Performing resource management, forecasting, leadership, and teambuilding.
Provide guidance to client service team on technical capabilities, staffing and infrastructure needs. Proactively identify and address project risks.
Empower and guide team through multiple releases
Identify efficiencies and improve the Software Development Lifecycle
Enforce a high standard of operational excellence and compliance.
Managing the quality and timeliness of update and deliverables.
Ensure that production procedure, change management, documentation and control are followed and continuously enhanced.
Serve as first-line of escalation from the project delivery teams on major operations issues and delivery challenges.
Meet with external clients to review account performance, resolve delivery issues and plan future phases of work.
Manage career paths by coaching and mentoring direct and indirect reports. Contribute to design and continue improvement of our marketing platforms.
Travel to client location between 25% (average) and up to 50% (for specific phases)
Qualifications:

Strong client interfacing background required
Ideally some experience in a consulting role from a systems integration perspective  
Proven ability to mentor/motivate reports and team members
Ability to communicate complex marketing technology concepts to marketers
Overall work experience of 14+ years
5+ years of Delivery Leadership experience
10+ years’ experience with software implementation from requirement through discovery/define, design, development, client acceptance, launch and manage
Strong experience in iterative delivery methodology
10+ years’ experience in digital/web technologies - ASP.net (preferred) or J2EE and relational/no-SQL platforms – Oracle (preferred), IBM, Cassandra, etc
Preferred: Working knowledge of marketing tool stack (Adobe, IBM, Oracle) and CRM databases (SalesForce, etc) and loyalty engines
Strong knowledge of deploying and managing systems in public cloud such as AWS that can scale on demand
Demonstrated experience leading a team of between 20+ individuals distributed over multiple locations in different time zones
Has built highly scalable data-driven web/digital applications that source data from multiple source systems
Ability to handle program management across multiple concurrent initiatives
BS in Computer Science or related discipline
   Conditions of Employment

Job Description - SR. Windows Systems Administrator (0088947)Job Description SR. Windows Systems Administrator - (0088947) Summary:
Senior Windows System Administrator is needed to support high availability production systems in a very large enterprise level environment with multiple global datacenters.
The candidate will work closely with network, application, and middleware teams to support Windows based product installations, customizations, and deployments. The candidate will be responsible for all aspects of Windows operating system support including software updates and upgrades, performance management and capacity planning for the Windows environment. Familiarity with scripting technologies such as Visual Basic and/or PowerShell is preferred. 
Responsibilities include ensuring best practice patch management processes are followed and continuous service improvement are identified and implemented as necessary to ensure compliance and successful audits. The candidate must have experience with the complete patch management lifecycle including testing, deploying, troubleshooting missing patches and patch issues, etc. utilizing the change management process and patch management and automation tools. Experience with PCI security vulnerability remediation is preferred. 
The candidate must be able to gather requirements and help architect, plan, and implement system solutions for a Windows platform to meet customer requirements. Experience with web servers, databases, networks, cabling, new installations and migrations, and security scanning tools is required. 
The Senior Windows System Administrator is responsible for day to day operational troubleshooting. Off-shift coverage will be required for on-call support of systems and maintenance work in supported change windows. The ability to write shell scripts and utility programs for Windows system maintenance is also a plus. To be successful in this position, the candidate must also display demonstrated teaming skills, written and oral communication skills, and formal documentation skills. 
Essential Functions:

Proficient in administrating and maintaining all currently supported Windows operating systems including updates, upgrades and performance and capacity management.
Windows server patching, security configurations, vulnerability scans, remediation and audits. Prioritizing, testing and deploying patches and application packaging using various deployment technologies including, but not limited to Microsoft WSUS, GFI Languard, and CA patch management and automation technologies
Experience gathering requirements and architect, plan, and implement system solutions for a Windows platform to meet customer requirements. 
Day to day operational support and on-call support of systems and maintenance work in supported change windows
Education Requirements:

Bachelor Degree (BS/Computer Science) 
These certificates are a plus

Microsoft certifications 
VMware certifications 
ITIL certification 
Work Experience:

Previous experience working in a large-scale, enterprise environment providing operational support by building, configuring, and managing Microsoft Windows O/S servers 
At least 3-5 years’ experience in managing Microsoft Active Directory to include implementation of GPOs, support of file and print services, DNS, Domain Controller replication, and organizational unit management. 
At least 5 years’ experience in managing Windows systems, including Windows Server 2003, Windows Server 2008, Window Server 2012, Windows server 2016. 
At least 2 years’ experience in working with virtual infrastructure (i.e. VMWare). 
1 year AWS or Azure systems support experience 
At least 2 years’ experience in utilizing VB/Powershell, BAT to automate common functions. 
Must demonstrate a detail oriented work ethic. 
Other Skills, Knowledge or Abilities

Excellent verbal and written communications 
Ability to track and administer several tasks concurrently 
Strong change management and ITIL background 
Large scale Active Directory experience 
Provide day to day operational support and on-call rotations 
Must be able to work nights and weekends during scheduled maintenance windows

Job Description - Lead Developer (Oracle/Service Layer) (0089761)Job Description Lead Developer (Oracle/Service Layer) - (0089761) Summary 
 
The position requires strong Oracle database knowledge to work on a complex rule based multi-channel marketing campaign platform supporting Fortune 100 companies.  The position’s purpose includes, but is not limited to:


Lead a team of developers to build/enhance  features of our Oracle platform.

Setup/configuration of the development environment

Analysis and design of new and enhanced features for the marketing platform as per business requirements

Communication with QA, product and production support teams etc. to deliver new or enhanced features and address issues/concerns

Lead multi-functional team for troubleshooting issues
Duties and responsibilities


Collaborate with developers, project managers, business analysts and business users in conceptualizing, estimating and developing new software applications and enhancements.

Define software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, providing time estimates for programming tasks and implementation plans.

Identifies appropriate risk and develops mitigation plan.

Perform definition, development, and documentation of software’s objectives, business requirements, deliverables, and specifications in collaboration with internal users and departments.

Develop technical documentation to define the system components, development environment and implementation planning/strategies

Prepare and dispense work assignments, provide guidance, and/or review the work of other team members.

Collaborate with UI design team to achieve functional requirements and QA team to define test cases, metrics, and resolve questions about test results.

Support organizational strategies, and provides organizational improvement.

Recommend business process flow improvements and clearly communicate problem/resolution process to project management.

Supports organization’s processes and procedures and can implement a new product or major modification/improvement independently from start to finish.

Researches market to identify and upcoming technology to implement within the company.

Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.

Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. 

Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel.
Skills
 


Ability to design and implement solutions that are reliable, scalable, and perform at a high-level to meet the service levels associated with mission-critical Oracle-based solutions.

Strong knowledge of database architecture and best practices for Oracle SQL and PL/SQL coding style and application tuning.

Strong experience with ER, logical and physical modeling of OLTP databases.

Good knowledge of  web services.

Excellent in impact-analysis and root cause analysis.

Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities with ability to anticipate and avoid problems.

Ability to define and implement migration strategies from legacy systems to new architecture and technologies.

Ability to work well within a team environment that includes offshore teams.

Ability to work within tight deadlines and effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.

Strong communication skills (verbal and written) and an ability to communicate with internal and external customers and all levels of management, including communicating technical information to nontechnical audiences.

Ability to design and build flexible and extensible systems with focus on code reuse and generation.
Qualifications
 


Candidates must possess a Bachelor's degree in Information Technology (IT), Computer Science (CS), Software Engineering, or a related discipline.

Oracle certifications a plus.

Experience designing and developing complex enterprise applications (ERP, CRM, etc.) on large Oracle databases using SDLC methodologies (agile, waterfall).

Experience in performance tuning, application monitoring and support of production applications with distributed teams.

Experience with writing detailed technical specifications for developers; design, validate and execute software test plans.

8+ years of overall IT/software development experience.

6+ years of recent experience as an Oracle developer.

Strong development experience with Oracle PL/SQL: construction of packages, triggers and PL/SQL blocks and Unix Korn shell scripting.

Working knowledge of SQL Server and experience in automotive marketing and/or CRM applications preferred.

Experience with MS Project, TFS and Java preferred.
